poem:
### Famine of Plenty

In aisled cathedrals, granite  
of commerce whispers—  
a silence in the bargain.  
We line the sacristy  
of checkout lanes,  
offering coins, a meager feel  
against papered scarcity.  
Yet, in this harvest of steel,  
shawled figures reap  
momentum,  
as the whisper becomes  
an echo of numbers—  
inflation's hymn.
